headline: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

content.title: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
content.summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

headline: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

content.title: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
content.summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

headline: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

content.title: Nvidia’s Fat Margins Are Google and AMD’s Opportunity
content.summary: The AI revolution has created a unique and high-quality problem for  Nvidia  : The chip maker makes too much money.  Nvidia has fallen under scrutiny over the past month as investors have come to worry about the sustainability of blowout artificial-intelligence spending.  Nvidia’s stock price has picked up some ground this week, but the shares are still down 12% since the company peaked at a $5 trillion market cap in late October.

headline: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

content.title: The AI Trade Has Powered Wall Street Through Bitcoin’s Wobble. It Sets Up a December Rally.
content.summary: If  Bitcoin  late autumn slump was meant to drive a stake into the heart of the animal spirits that have powered risky assets higher for much of the past three years, the stock market appears largely unscathed and more than willing to roll the dice into the final weeks of December.  Bitcoin prices, which are inexorably tied to investor sentiment, have rebounded firmly over the past two days, taking the world’s largest cryptocurrency back above $93,000 and stoking risk appetite in markets around the world.

headline: Amazon Expands Its Used Car Blitz As Auto Loan Rates Drop
summary: Used-car wholesale prices declined slightly compared with a year ago in the first half of November and, as new and used car loan rates fall, sales are expected to pick up moving toward the end of the year.  Ford is the second auto company to offer models on the platform.
